book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: Whither is thy kinsman gone, thou beautiful among women? whither has thy kinsman turned aside? tell us , and we will seek him with thee.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: My kinsman is gone down to his garden, to the beds of spice, to feed his flock in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: I am my kinsman's, and my kinsman is mine, who feeds among the lilies.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: Thou art fair, my companion, as Pleasure, beautiful as Jerusalem, terrible as armies set in array.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: Turn away thine eyes from before me, for they have ravished me: thy hair is as flocks of goats which have appeared from Galaad.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: Thy teeth are as flocks of shorn sheep , that have gone up from the washing, all of them bearing twins, and there is none barren among them: thy lips are as a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: Thy cheek is like the rind of a pomegranate, being seen without thy veil.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: There are sixty queens, and eighty concubines, and maidens without number.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: My dove, my perfect one is one; she is the only one of her mother; she is the choice of her that bore her. The daughters saw her, and the queens will pronounce her blessed, yea, and the concubines, and they will praise her.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: Who is this that looks forth as the morning, fair as the moon, choice as the sun, terrible as armies set in array?

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: I went down to the garden of nuts, to look at the fruits of the valley, to see if the vine flowered, if the pomegranates blossomed.

book: Brenton Septuagint Translation Song of Solomon 6
text: There I will give thee my breasts: my soul knew it not: it made me as the chariots of Aminadab.
